member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgress
member.summary: The class represents a unit of progress in the WFC algorithm. As the algorithm is run, a sequence of WCFProgress items will be returned. Different types of progress will be returned, and you can switch on the type to gain insights to the algorithm's decisions...

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCError
member.summary: A WFCError instance could be returned by the WFC algorithm. If you receive one of these instances, it means something with the process has broken.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotModuleRemoved
member.summary: A progress instance that explains what module was removed from a slot's possibility space.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotModuleRemoved.slot
member.summary: The slot that has had a module removed.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotModuleRemoved.module
member.summary: The module that is no longer available for the slot

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.Module
member.summary: In the WFC algorithm, a module is a possibility for some

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.Slot
member.summary: In the WFC algorithm, a Slot is a place that holds one . As the Wave Function is being collapsed, the slot may have many potential modules available to it. As the collapse continues, modules are removed as possibilities from the slot, until there is only one module possible for the slot.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.Slot.Coordinate
member.summary: The slot's position in the larger generation space.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotEdge
member.summary: A SlotEdge is the connection between two slots. In a simple 2D 1X2 grid case, there are two slots, and one slot edge connecting them. The term "edge" comes from Graph Theory. These edges are directional.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotEdge.Source
member.summary: The origin slot of the edge.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotEdge.Target
member.summary: The destination slot of the edge.
